review: Works perfectly and is even smaller than I expected.  It uses a single HDMI connection for both audio and video.  The WIFI transmission is very fast, I have a 30+ mbps hardwire internet service to my router.  Netflix use is smooth with no pauses in streaming.  Playing a movie wirelessly from m iPad or Macbook is seamless and the audio and video match up perfectly with no synchronization issues.  If you own Mac devices and especially movies purchased through iTunes you should have an Apple TV.
author: ERIC WATTERS

review: A lot of people see my AppleTV and still aren't sure what it does. Simply put, it can rent or buy on-demand movies and TV shows, buy music form the iTunes store, stream videos from Vimeo, YouTube or Netflix, plus Hockey, baseball and basketball (with a subscription).The feature I use most, however, is to stream the music and movies I already have on my computers to the TV in my living room. It's so easy to set up; just join your home wifi network, enter a name and password and you're all set. Any Mac or PC in the house, running iTunes, will automatically show up and stream to your TV.Yes, Roku, Xbox, PlayStation and other devices can do some or all of the above features, and if you have one of those, you probably don't need this. But the AppleTV is the simplest solution of them all. If you want something that a babysitter can figure out immediately without a lengthy training session, or something you can put in a guest room for company, or a way for your small children to watch their favorite cartoons over and over again, this is the way to go.
